facts: Everything around you is made of tiny particles called atoms, and different kinds of atoms are called elements.
Atoms can join together to form molecules, and water is a molecule made of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
In a chemical reaction, atoms are rearranged to make new substances, but the total number of each type of atom stays the same.
The periodic table is a map of the elements, and elements in the same column often behave in similar ways.
Acids and bases are chemicals that can change how substances act, and the pH scale from 0 to 14 measures how acidic or basic something is.
Some reactions give off energy as heat or light, while others need energy added to make them happen.
Catalysts can speed up chemical reactions without being used up, and enzymes in your body are catalysts that help you digest food.
